data.text:
In more general anthologies

in Slavonic Fairy Tales (1874), edited and translated by John T. Naaké:

Lidushka and the Water Demon's Wife retold by Matěj Mikšíček

Golden Hair retold by Karel Jaromír Erben

Yanechek and the Water Demon retold by Josef Kajetán Tyl

The Wise Judgment retold by Josef Košín z Radostova

The Long-desired Child retold by Karel Jaromír Erben

The Wicked Wood-Fays retold by Karel Jaromír Erben

Wisdom and Fortune retold by Karel Jaromír Erben

The Brownie, or House Spirit retold by Karel Jaromír Erben

In magazines

in The Czechoslovak Review:

Fairy Tale About a Prince and Three Journeymen (1919) by Václav Tille

The Twelve Months (1919) retold by Božena Němcová

"Národopisný Věstník Českoslovanský" by Leonard Cyril Wharton in Folk-Lore, 22 (4) ( )

"Recent Work in Slavonic Folklore" by Leonard Cyril Wharton in Folk-Lore, 27 (3) ( )

"Czech Folk-Tales" by Leonard Cyril Wharton in Folk-Lore, 30 (3) ( )

"Prague Letter" by Percy Beaumont Wadsworth in The Dial, Series 3, 73 ( )

"Prague Letter" by Percy Beaumont Wadsworth in The Dial, Series 3, 75 ( )

"Prague Letter" by Otokar Fischer in The Dial, Series 3, 75 ( )
